description: I have install Mycroft from software and with a bit of tweaking it works well but this is a useless implementation. Its better not to put anything up than to put stuff that so buggy. Too bad because its a great project let down by this poor implementation and documentation. Users will get the wrong idea of the abilties of the project.

I guess the vision impaired and others with special needs are supposed to just magically overcome their impairment as far as linux devs are concerned. I've never seen a finer example of the aloof disregard the open source community shows for others than in the Universal Access category. Every Apple OS going back as far as I can remember has been there for people with disabilities with assistive technology. Get with it developers! Its 2022! Not 1984!
